instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2901: What is 820-2901? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2091: What is 820-2091? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..

threads.title: iMac 27 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2901</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) turn on but no image
threads.message: Lcd connector is replaced and now turn on ,chime but no image (backlight is on but fully bright ) <SIGNAL>PP12V_LCD</SIGNAL> is 11.88V ,<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_VIDEO</SIGNAL> is 3.3V ,i try different display ,cable,another bios ,graphic card same sh***T

threads.title: iMac 27 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2901</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) turn on but no image
iMac 27 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2901</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) turn on but no image
threads.message: Bad soldering on connector or connector damaged. Check <CAPACITOR>C9040</CAPACITOR> and friends for continuity to LCD connector.

threads.title: iMac 27 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2901</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) turn on but no image
threads.message: Solder another lcd connector same ,check all continuity to LCD connector all ok ,what else can cause no image ?

threads.title: iMac 27 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2901</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) turn on but no image
threads.message: Was the connector damaged to start with? Diode mode on both sides of <CAPACITOR>C9040</CAPACITOR> and friends with LCD plugged in if possible.

threads.title: iMac 27 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2901</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) turn on but no image
threads.message: Man to measure with screen plugged  in very tricky ,visually all looking good,yes connector was damaged in first place ,solder new one very clean and all connection looking good ,could be SMC or something else

threads.title: iMac 27 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2901</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) turn on but no image
threads.message: I found another board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2091</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> but this one <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is missing on <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>,try to replace but still same ,<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> is there 5V

threads.title: iMac 27 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2901</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) turn on but no image
threads.message:
It must be something in the DP lines. Do diode mode on <CAPACITOR>C9040</CAPACITOR> and friends on pin 1 which is the MUX side. Then check from pin 2 to the other side of a plugged in LCD cable. If that is all good it could be a MUX issue <CHIP>U9200</CHIP>. Check diode mode on <CAPACITOR>C9240</CAPACITOR> and friends on both sides and inspect for damage around <CHIP>U9200</CHIP>.
Have you tried if external video is working, if not then it could be something totally different of course.
